title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, fry pancetta in a large skillet until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Remove skillet from heat, add pasta to pancetta.
Quickly stir in egg mixture, adding pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra Parmesan and parsley.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and half the tikka masala spice for 30 minutes.
Heat butter in a large pan and cook onion until soft.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Add remaining spices and cook until fragrant.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Grill or pan-fry marinated chicken until cooked through.
Add chicken to sauce with coconut cream.
Simmer for 10 minutes and garnish with cilantro.

title: Caesar Salad
summary: A green salad of romaine lettuce and croutons dressed with lemon juice, olive oil, egg, Worcestershire sauce, anchovies, garlic, Dijon mustard, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper.
instructions: Make the dressing: Mash garlic and anchovies into a paste.
Whisk in egg yolk, lemon juice, and Dijon mustard.
Slowly drizzle in olive oil while whisking constantly.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss romaine lettuce with dressing.
Add croutons and Parmesan cheese.
Serve immediately.

title: Chocolate Lava Cake
summary: A rich chocolate cake with a warm, gooey center that flows like lava when you cut into it.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Butter and dust 4 ramekins with cocoa powder.
Melt chocolate and butter together, stirring until smooth.
Whisk eggs, egg yolks, and sugar until thick and pale.
Fold chocolate mixture into eggs.
Sift in flour and salt, fold gently.
Divide batter among ramekins.
Bake for 12-14 minutes until edges are set but center jiggles.
Let cool for 1 minute, then invert onto plates.
Serve immediately with vanilla ice cream.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Crispy corn tortillas filled with seasoned ground beef, lettuce, cheese, and salsa.
instructions: Brown ground beef in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Drain excess fat.
Add taco seasoning and water according to package directions.
Simmer for 5 minutes until thickened.
Warm taco shells according to package directions.
Fill each shell with beef mixture.
Top with lettuce, cheese, tomato, sour cream, and salsa.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A colorful mix of fresh vegetables stir-fried in a savory sauce with garlic and ginger.
instructions: Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch in a small bowl.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add broccoli and carrot, stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Add bell pepper and snap peas, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Pour in sauce mixture and toss to coat vegetables.
Cook for 1 minute until sauce thickens.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve over rice.

title: Pancakes
summary: Fluffy buttermilk pancakes served with maple syrup and butter.
instructions: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
In another bowl, whisk buttermilk, eggs, and melted butter.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and mix until just combined (lumps are okay).
Heat a griddle or skillet over medium heat and lightly grease.
Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on surface, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes more.
Serve hot with maple syrup and butter.

title: Greek Moussaka
summary: A layered casserole of eggplant, ground meat, and béchamel sauce, baked to perfection.
instructions: Slice eggplants, salt them, and let sit for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry.
Fry eggplant slices in olive oil until golden. Set aside.
Cook ground meat with onion and garlic until browned.
Add crushed tomatoes and cinnamon, simmer for 20 minutes.
Make béchamel: Melt butter, add flour, cook for 1 minute.
Gradually whisk in milk, cook until thickened.
Remove from heat, whisk in eggs and Parmesan.
Layer eggplant, meat sauce, and béchamel in a baking dish.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 45 minutes until golden.
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
